snippet: Thieves who target burls, protrusions on trees that are valued for their intricately patterned wood, are driven by a sluggish economy and costly methamphetamine habits, officials said.
abstract: Poachers who butcher rare old-growth coast redwoods in California, targeting burls, protrusions on trees that are valued for their intricately patterned wood, are driven by a sluggish economy and costly methamphetamine habits; spate of burl poaching, with 18 known cases in the last year, has forced park officials to close the Newton B Drury Scenic Parkway at night to deter criminals.
lead_paragraph: Thieves who target burls, protrusions on trees that are valued for their intricately patterned wood, are driven by a sluggish economy and costly methamphetamine habits, officials said.

headline.main: Poachers Attack Beloved Elders of California, Its Redwoods
headline.print_headline: Poachers Attack Beloved Elders of California, Its Redwoods
